Name: Dicetroy the Castle
Description:
Greetings, noble Castellan Ruler to Dicetroy the Castle. As a Castellan, you have many obligations to your family’s name - build castles, protect them, earn treasure, and deliver prosperity to your people. You do this by wisely utilizing the resources your subjects provide as well as waging war on your rivals and attacking their castle and accumulating the most treasure to be the mightiest Castlan Ruler of them all!

Dicetroy the Castle is a dice rolling, matching, stacking, and smashing resource management and dexterity battle game for 2 players.

BASICS OF PLAY

Each player selects 1 Castelan Ruler player screen/backsplash and 20 dice of one color. To prepare for the CULTIVATE phase of each round players will set their screen in front of their battle zone.

CULTIVATE
Flip the 90-second timer (you may choose to play “Peasant mode” and exclude the timer and have the Cultivate Phase be untimed).

From behind their Castellan screen, each player rolls all 20 of their six-sided dice at the same time then sorts, allocates, and places dice from dice that have at least one or more matching values. Unmatched dice and dice that you had no use for or dice that did not get placed before time runs out are returned to your dice pool or "Banished". these are failed farmers and craftsmen who didn't deliver on their promised goods.

PROSPER
Unveil your kingdom! Lift your Castellan screen and place it behind your castle.

DECREE!
Certain Castellan abilities trigger and resolve. State these abilities to your Rival.

PROFIT! 
Claim your treasure! Calculate how much treasure you earned and increase your Treasure die accordingly.

WAGE WAR!
Determine which player will attack first by comparing the combined outcome of your Knight dice then alternate attacking each other until a player runs out of boulders or a player is raided making sure to clear all castle rubble in between attacks. After attacking has ended Fortify by either repositioning or clearing dice inside the Castle Zone, adding them back to your dice pool.

When Fortifying all layers must be completed before continuing to build on a castle. All Dice but those remaining in the Castle zone and the Treasure die are returned to that player’s dice pool.

For each completed layer of your Castle still standing after the war has ended, earn 1 Treasure. The first player to end a round with 20 Treasure is the lord of the land and the winner of the game!

THAT IS THE END OF THE AGE! (one round)

—description from the designer

Name: KICÉKI
Description:
KICÉKI is an adult card game. 
Say out loud what you think and find out what your friends think of you.

Rules of the game:

QUESTION: The first player chooses a question from one of his 5 "question" cards.

VOTING: Each player uses a voting card to designate the player who they think best corresponds to the question asked. Voting is anonymous.

GUESS: The player who asked the question says, “in your opinion, KI CÉ KI”? ". The player who thinks they have received the most votes points to the assembly by raising their hand.

REVEAL: The player who read the question collects all the voting cards and reveals them to all players.

Then give away the anecdotes that justified your choice!

KICÉKI est un jeu de cartes adulte pour apéro et soirées

Règles du jeu: 
INTERROGE: Le premier joueur choisit une question parmi l’une de ses 5 cartes « question ». 
VOTE: Chaque joueur utilise une carte de vote pour désigner le joueur qui correspond selon lui le mieux à la question posée. Le vote est anonyme. 
DEVINE: Le joueur qui a posé la question dit : « à votre avis, KI CÉ KI » ? ». Le joueur qui pense avoir reçu le plus de votes se désigne auprès de l’assemblée en levant la main. 
RÉVÈLE: Le joueur qui a lu la question collecte toutes les cartes de vote et les révèle à l’ensemble des joueurs.
BALANCE: Les joueurs partagent à l’assemblée les anecdotes marrantes qui ont justifié leur vote.

C’est le moment de sortir les gros dossiers… Exemples de cartes Question:
KICÉKI a le pire historique de navigation sur Internet ? KICÉKI n'ose pas renvoyer une bouteille de vin bouchonnée ?
KICÉKI a toujours les pires plans foireux ? 
KICÉKI renifle ses vêtements pour savoir s'ils sont propres ? 
KICÉKI répond 'oui' sans avoir écouté la question ?

Name: Color Shapes Match
Description:
Round of the player


     Insert a card from your hand in a place a place up, down, right, left or diagonals from another card  on the table.
     Do the same with the second card in your hand.
     If you want, take a card from the table in your hand and place it in the same way.
     Get a card from the table that has in its center the shape and color of a shape that has been completed on the table. You can do the same thing as many times as you want if the condition exists.
     Place the cards you won in front of you and draw 2 new cards from the deck. That's where your round ends and then the player on the left plays.

Name: Premier Arrivé: 14-18 La Der des Ders
Description:
Retrace the history of the Great War with this "Der des Ders" (The war to end all wars) battle game.
This battle game on a board where the first to arrive at the end of the game will be the winner. 
But watch out for the mud in the trenches!

This strategy and adventure game develops children's imagination and thinking.

Discover the history of WWI with 1000 bornes-type system.

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Pack of the Crypt
Description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Belphegor and Herne the Hunter)
2 Heroes (Bruno Dawn and Carolyn Totenkopf)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Cobold, Scurrilet, Fachan)

Maps:
2 Maps (Rome Catacombs and Paris Catacombs)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Cibaciba, Caleuche, Tuonela)
2 Region Cards (Poland and Italy)
3 Trooper Cards Types (Carabinieri, Swiss Guard, Territorials)

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Nightmare Pack
Description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Tuchulcha and Mezu)
2 Heroes (Scott Delrich and Eva Noel)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Imp Swarm, Wraith Swarm, Killakee Swarm)

Maps:
2 Maps (The Wave and The Last Redoubt)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Youdu, Xibalba, Drakulu)
2 Region Cards (Republic of China and People's Republic of China)
2 Trooper Cards Types (Reservist, Air Strike)

Name: Castleshire
Description:
Enter a mystical kingdom ruled by an eccentric Majesty besotted with the idea of building the perfect castle. Deft guilds and shady allies thrive in a realm that the world will remember as Castleshire: the land of the thousand castles. You are a rising master-builder and dream of leaving a lasting legacy. You decide to compete in building the chambers of their Majesty’s perfect castle. You are driven by one goal: To become the most famous master-builder of all time.

Everyone is always active. This game has literally no downtime for players. In your turn, you set out to build the castle and increase your fame. You either do this certified using your limited resources or chaotically in an unplanned matter. When not on your turn, you endeavor to bring your adversaries down when they attempt the latter. Use the unique skills of your guild that have been mastered over generations. At any time, everyone is able to force a turn of events to a certain degree with the help of allies who are sprawling in the vicinity of the epic construction site.

A good memory and reading opponents are as helpful as a good poker face. In this socially interactive bluffing game, you will win if you if you are clever and the wittiest of all - constantly adapted to counter other players' evolving strategies.

Solo variant: Castleshire's AI is able to bluff and memorize, and also adjusts to how well you catch the AI's bluffs. Additionally, it captures your bluffing behavior and responds to it. Once you start winning against the AI, you can increase the difficulty level, so you will have to think further ahead and anticipate the AI's next moves more accurately.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arawn
Description:
Object: Capture the opponent's King

The game is played on an 8x8 board. The pieces consists of 1 King and 8 Warriors for each side.

How a Warrior moves varies depending on the number of Warriors for its side that are left on the board. The less Warriors you have, the more powerful they become.

8 - Steps forward (in the 3 - diagonal & straight - forward directions)
7 - Steps diagonally
6 - Steps orthogonally
5 - Slides diagonally
4 - Slides orthogonally
3 - Slides diagonally + steps orthogonally
2 - Slides orthogonally + steps diagonally
1 - Slides orthogonally + slides diagonally

The King moves by stepping orthogonally and diagonally.

Captures are mandatory and are done by replacement, like Chess.

—description from the designer

Name: Top Trumps Quiz: FC Schalke 04
Description:
QUIZ Schalke 04 “Blue and white, how I love you”

Prove your passion now with the QUIZ Schalke 04! 
All information about the club and its players is brought together here. 
So kick off and let's go! If your greatest passion is soccer and you don't miss a game of the Royal Blues, then we have just the right thing for 2 players or teams from 6 years of age. Because in this QUIZ your memory will be put to the test twice with a total of 500 questions. 
In the first round, each player or team draws five cards. Read the first question out to you one at a time. If only one of you has the correct answer, he receives the card. If both are correct, it continues until one answers the question incorrectly. If both players or teams do not know the answer to the first question or answer all five questions correctly, the cards land in the middle. Now you continue with the next card and if you can answer the question correctly while your opponent is wrong, you will receive the stack of cards from the middle. Whoever has collected three cards wins the first round. In the second round you shuffle the ten cards you have already played, distribute them again among you and play the cards again. If your little head is not only an absolute ace in the header, but was also able to remember most of the first round and collect three cards again, you win the game.

Name: Five Options from the Notepad: Optional rules for Five Parsecs
Description:
This expansion pack offers new optional rules for your games of Five Parsecs From Home.

Included is

     an alternate approach to close combat,
     rules for adopting a defensive stance in combat,
     a new (risky) option for firing while dashing,
     an alternate approach to armor,
     a new hit point system if you want a more RPG-style experience 
     and finally random AI tables to make your gun fights more unpredictable.


While designed for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition, these options should be adaptable to other Five X systems as well.

—description from the publisher

Name: Galactic War: Starship Rules
Description:
A game of battles in deep space stats are included for a number of human and alien factions.

The rules use a simple system of opposed dice rolls any advantages or disadvantages simply add more dice, the game uses various different dice D4,6,8,10 and 10 and ideally you will need a couple of each/player.

Hopefully fun and easy to play the different factions abilities should make for some varied games with different challenges.

—description from the publisher's website
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Angela & Enchantress
Description:
Amora the Enchantress has devoted her immortal life to the pusuit of power. One of the most powerful magic-wielders in Asgard, Amora is well known for her immense beauty and infamous for her heartless scheming in order to get whatever she desires. Able to enact powerful charms, the Enchantress is able to bend even the strongest resolve to her will.

Firstborn of Odin and Freyja, Angela was kidnapped by Heven during the war between Heven and Asgard. Thought dead by her parents, Angela was raised and trained to be one of Heven’s deadliest hunters and warriors. Having learned of her true parentage, Angela cast aside her loyalty to Heven and to Odin, choosing to serve no master but her own conscience. She nor travels the cosmos fighting against any evil which dares cross her path, both alongside her brother Thor, and as part of the Guardians of the Galaxy.

Box contains:

1 Angela Miniature
1 Enchantress Miniature
2 Bases
2 Character Stat Cards
3 Team Tactic Cards
10 Tokens

Name: Fantastic Factories: Subterfuge
Description: Subterfuge is an expansion to Fantastic Factories that adds new blueprints as well as direct player interaction in the form of contractors that you can hire to steal resources, cards, or even dice! Subterfuge also introduces the sabotage mechanic which can be used to disable your opponent's factories.

Name: The Legend of Ezmerelda
Description:
The Legend of Ezmerelda, is inspired by Nintendo’s popular RPG from 1986. 1 or more players explore the world while: meeting new allies, discovering dungeons, and combating throngs of enemies, in order to recover lost artifacts and return them to their owners.

Playing is a creative adventure that triggers the imagination as the story unfolds that is unique to each game. Use a six(6)-side die in combination with cards and maps to explore the world and recover artifacts, while gaining experience with their character and increasing various stats. Characters must observe the passage of time for practicing skills and abilities, 1 game hour is equal to 1 real-world minute.

1 or more players move 1 Hex plot at a time around the World map. If multiple players are working together in a party, 1 member is designated as the dice roller and the person to draw the cards. If entering a dungeon, the designated person draws cards to determine the enemies and rewards within. If entering a town, cards are drawn to determine which quests are available. During gameplay, each player's character can increase the values of certain skills and abilities on their character sheet and they may add or remove party members.

The game continues until the player(s) decide the game should end.

—description from the designer

Name: Super Yaniv
Description:
This is a game for 2-4 players played over several rounds. The aim of the game is to be the player with the smallest sum in  hand by the end of the round. Platers are eliminated if their total reaches over 200 points. Once all other players have been eliminated, the remaining player is the winner. It is a derivative/reimplimentation of Yaniv.

Players begin the game with a hand of 5 cards. On their turn, a player first discards one or more cards from the hand (sets of same cards or runs) and then takes a card from the deck or a previous discard. The main difference from the original Yaniv is the inclusion of tactic cards.

Name: Jane Austen's Revenge
Description:
The cure for a broken heart is... Revenge

Jane Austen’s Revenge is an expansion for Jane Austen’s Matchmaker Chapter Two. Nothing spices up a good romance like a dash of bitterness and betrayal.

As one of Society’s premier matchmakers, your goal remains the same – to gain the most Prestige – but you must also settle scores with your rivals to finish the game holding as few Grudges as possible.

Grudge cards
Each player starts the game with 2 Grudge cards. During play you draw Grudge cards whenever someone does something to vex you – such as declining your proposal. Grudge cards can be played during the game to hurt your rivals. Each Grudge card in your hand subtracts 5 Prestige from your final score. So getting even is always preferable to staying mad.

A Change of Heart card can be played when you propose a match to alter two of your character’s Traits – making one better and the other worse.
Duel

Some grudges can only be settled with a Duel. In polite society this may mean a war of words, a sword fight, pistols at dawn, or even a horse race!

Turmoil cards potentially affect everyone but, if played cleverly, can mitigate the effects on your characters while making your rivals suffer.
Lady Susan

A marriage to the beautiful and capricious Lady Susan is apt to be short and vexatious. A quick divorce later, and she’s back in the game!
Patronage

If things aren’t going your way, you can ask an influential patron to change your luck! If you roll the Trait on the card you may change it to your patron’s preferred Trait instead.

Name: Never Say Never
Description:
Never Say Never is the hilarious game of horrible hypotheticals. If you’ve ever been that friend who asks your friends if they would do something really wild or crazy for say, a million dollars, then you’re likely the type of person who would get a kick out of this party game.

The rules are pretty simple. During each round of the game, one player challenges the other players with a hypothetical scenario by playing a card from their hand. If the other players would never do it, then whoever played the card gets the point. If somebody (or multiple people) would do it, then they need to explain to the group how on Earth they could justify doing something that ridiculous. Whoever’s answer is deemed the best wins the point in that instance.

The game ends when one player scores 10 points...or after everyone erupts into everlasting laughter and judgement of their friends.

-description from publisher

Name: Fliptricks
Description:
In Fliptricks, you have to be the last standing skater that has performed all of the tricks without falling off of your board or breaking it. All players play at once, perfoming tricks at the same time, and only the best skaters will continue.

Fliptricks is a tiny card-flipping game that uses the edge of the table, a bunch of dexterity and a little luck.


Released in the May 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Flames of War: Tiger Tank Platoon
Description:
The Tiger tank has such a reputation amongst Allied tankers, that any tank that held up their advance became a ‘Tiger’.

With armour capable of stopping nearly all Allied anti-tank rounds, and a gun that penetrates Allied tanks with ease, its reputation is well deserved.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Otete Artist
Description:
This game is a party game with a nonfree message transmission system.
The player on your turn uses his or her hand to represent the answer to one of several art cards.
The other players have to guess which card is the one represented by the hand.
The player who guesses, and the player whose turn it is, gets a point!
However, if they all get hit, the turn player gets zero points!

Name: The Millennium War
Description:
Once in a Millennium, when all the elements of the Universe are aligned, the Millennium gate emerges and releases powerful cosmic energies in the form of mythical beasts, sacred weapons and spells. This is an opportunity to harness the cosmic energy and win the prolonged war between 2 powerful forces: The Virtues and The Sinners.From around the world come the most powerful heroes from both spectrums. They travel to the dangerous shadow realm to claim the power and to keep it from falling into the enemy’s hands. Whoever shall claim the millennium gate shall win the war, the Millennium War.

In the Millennium War, there are two game modes: competitive mode and cooperative mode. In competitive mode, players go head to head while building their strategy by selecting teams of legendary heroes, buying items, preparing passive spells to counterattack, and most importantly planning their actions by managing mana resources and movement across the Millennium Arena. 
There are 3 ways to win in competitive mode: eliminate all your opponents' teams of heroes, destroy all your opponents' ancient structures or claim the Millennium Gate by hunting powerful mythical beasts. 
Millennium War's competitive mode is inspired by the popular MOBA games but adjusted to be one of a kind as a board game.  You don’t win by speed and accuracy, or control of your keyboard, but by how you think and plan your strategy with a combination of choices. Similar to Chess but way more fun. Whether crushing your enemies with extreme power, trapping them with self destruct explosives and sacrificing one of your hero's for a few of theirs, brain controlling enemy hero's or even switching positions, there are endless ways to gain a strategic advantage. Build combos with 35 special Millennium Hero's and their endless combinations of weapons and spells.
In contrast to the swift pace of Competitive mode is the journey to the Millennium world in Cooperative mode, where players must work together to defeat Millennium Bosses. Each Boss presents a unique way of attack and has its own topography that’ll require the entire team to solve the puzzle to defeat the powerful Boss.
The game offers countless excitement, it’s fun and full of surprises, easy to play and tracks game play because of uniquely designed and patented smart dials, dealer shoes, hero cards and icons. Offering a supporting website featuring hero skills diagrams for easy learning, along with in depth character design inspired by world cultures and game mechanics. The game miniatures are lovingly made with highly detailed craftsmanship by talented artists from around the world. They also magnetically attach to the smart dial.

Name: Combopolis
Description:
With your team's careful guidance, the city and the countryside are expanding and converging. With everything growing at a breakneck pace, you are now tasked with managing the entire region!

A 6-card combo pack that allows you to combine Sprawlopolis and Agropolis.

Unlike the original rules for both standalone games, this variant eliminates the use of card-passing. Rather, players shuffle each game deck individually, flipping a single card from each to reveal 2 scoring conditions. Then, a 3rd card is drawn at random from the 6-card combo pack to reveal the 3rd and final scoring condition. A separate card from this pack is used as the starting tile, displaying 2 "blocks" from those terrains included in each game respectively.

On a player's turn, they draw 1 card from each game deck and must choose 1 to play and 1 to discard. In this way, both game decks with run out at the same rate. End game occurs after the last 2 cards are drawn and played/discarded.

Players score for the largest 2 block groups from each game, lose points for individual roads, and score/lose points according to the 3 scoring condition cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dreidel Revolution
Description:
Dreidel Revolution contains eight brand new games that remain authentic to the traditional Hanukkah game of dreidel, but add new elements to make the dreidel-playing experience better.

The game contains regular dreidels, plus original components like tokens, a Shamash button, and Eight Crazy Dice (d8 with dreidel symbols on them). These components broaden gameplay to allow for choice, strategy, and skill instead of the pure game of chance that is traditional dreidel. The eight games are:

"Gelt or Gift" gives players two competing ways to win and a choice to make after each spin.

"All Together Now" introduces simultaneous spinning so that every player participates in every turn.

"Follow the Leader" is a fairer form of traditional dreidel that gives everyone a chance to beat the best spin/roll combo.

"Beat the Dreidel" is a fast-paced game that requires skill, speed, and luck.

"Spin & Save" raises the stakes in each round, forcing players to choose whether to spend or bank their winnings.

"Hanukkah Chutzpah" tests your ability to tell a lie with a straight face. Can you fool the other players or will you get called out for your chutzpah?

"Superpowered Dreidels" gives each dreidel symbol a superpower that can be used to attack or defend a dreidel spin.

"Maccabee Stacking Bee" takes dreidels to the next level, using them for spinning and as building blocks in ever-growing stacking challenges.

Name: The 7th Citadel: On the Edge of Peril
Description:
The Collapsing Lands are aptly named. Every step you take could see the ground open up like a gaping maw, eager to swallow you whole. But what if there were a hidden world below, filled with secrets and treasures just waiting to be discovered?

“On the Edge of Peril” is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion offered in the Collector's Edition pledge.

It expands your adventures with new Exploration cards that will hinder your progress until you fight off the danger.

During your adventure, you may be instructed (no spoilers ?) to slip the “Peril” divider behind the 110 card. Whenever you take a Terrain card stored after that divider (card nr. 111 and up), you must replace 1 Exploration card attached to that terrain with one showing the “Peril” (skull) icon.

Luckily, you possess a Groundquaker, a powerful artifact stolen from the Necrodruids, which will help you push the divider further back and with it the edge of peril!

Name: Rebellion
Description:
Rebellion is a social deduction party game set in the late Soviet era. It pits those looking to overthrow the government against those seeking to infiltrate and sabotage the resistance.

For setup, players are given unique roles such as Doctor or Hacker (each with a special ability) and then split into two secret teams: Rebels and Spies.

Each player's turn has three steps: Draw, Check, and Recruit. First, a player draws an event card and follows the instructions on it. These cards may do things such as kill other players, change loyalties, or provide valuable information. Then players check to see if enough players are recruited. If there aren't, players end their turn by recruiting another player, who goes next.

When there are enough recruited players, The Rebellion starts: loyalties are revealed and counted. Whichever team got more players recruited wins.

-description from designer

Name: The Front: Assault in the Trenches
Description:
The war game THE FRONT: Assault in the Trenches Solo or two-player game, Powered by combat tables, simulates a trench skirmish at a micro-tactile level.

This game can be found at https://www.wargamevault.com/product/329440/THE-FRONT-Assault-in-the-trenches

Juego solitario o para dos jugadores, Con motor de tablas de combate, simula una escaramusa de trincheras a nivel microtactico.

Name: Bagels
Description:
A common defense strategy in Checkers is to keep a piece on the edge of the board so it can not be jumped. This game is played on an edgeless board - a torus. That means all pieces are equally exposed to capture. The top and the bottom of the game board are considered to be connected, as well as the two sides with each other, forming a donut - or bagel - shaped playing field.

A secondary effect of playing on a torus is there is no need for Kings. A piece leaving one edge of the board will simply be re-entered at the appropriate space on the other edge.

Object: Capture all your opponent's Bagels by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

The two sides are known as Plain and Pumpernickel.

Bagels move one square diagonally forward, but may capture in any of the five non-retreating directions - vertically, diagonally forward, or sideways. Jumping over a piece captures it. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

-description from designer

Name: Svenska konungar och drottningar
Description:
This game has a basic Go Fish gameplay but with changes to set make-up, collection and scoring. Each card features a king, queen or queen consort of Sweden, most of them grouped into royal houses. Sets are collected as singles where applicable, complete houses, or "families" (partial houses). If a family has been collected, remaining cards from that house can be freely collected as "bonus cards" for lesser points, but whichever other conditions apply, a king must be collected along with their consort or consorts. Play continues as in regular Go Fish until the draw deck is empty and all cards have been claimed, at which time points are counted up from singles, houses, families and bonus cards to find the winner.

—user summary

Name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Hellènes
Description:
ARS BELLUM: Hellenes Extension

The Hellenes expansion contains

     1 scenario booklet to play the battles of:
         Potidea (432 BC),
         Spartolos (429 BC),
         Olpae (426 BC),
         Amphipolis (422 BC) and
         Délion (424 BC)
    
     1 board of 108 counters representing Athenian, Spartan and Theban armies as well as two armies of mercenaries or Greek allies
     3 A4 cards and 1 A3 card


Requires ARS BELLUM base module

L'extension Hellènes contient

     1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles de 
         Potidée (432 av JC), 
         Spartolos (429 av JC),
         Olpae (426 av JC),
         Amphipolis (422 av JC) et
         Délion (424 av JC) 
    
     1 planche de 108 pions représentant les armées athéniennes, spartiates, thébaines, et deux armées de mercenaires ou alliés grecs
     3 cartes A4 et 1 carte A3


Nécessite le module de base d'ARS BELLUM

Name: Kulturspillet
Description:
A trivia game with 18 categories. Questions have a Danish bias. Played in up to six teams.

On your turn you answer a question in one of the categories of the square you are on. If you answer correctly, you roll the die and advance on the board.

—user summary

Name: Hidden Society Of The Gnomes: Invasion Cards
Description:
Gnome invasion has begun. The world is divided into two factions.

Will you help gnomes to restore their ancient glory and take over the world?
Will you help humans to dissipate such savagery, and repel this invasion?
Battle strategies need to be plotted as the future of the Earth is in your hands!

Hidden society of the gnomes: Invasion Cards, is an exhilarating semi-strategic card game for 2-4 players. (if 4 players, then 2 vs 2 teams)
Use your cleverness, traps and decoy maneuvers to overpower your opponent. Plot schemes, use some wit and count on some luck, cause only then you might come out as a winner!
This game is family friendly and suits all ages who can read!
Invasion Cards for collectors and competitive friends/family!

One game lasts 20-40 minutes!

All the cards are related to the book “Hidden society of the gnomes: Great Invasion”.
Some cards contain secret powers that can only be used when You have found the “effect” with the help of the book.
There are a few cards with hidden messages and secrets!
Two factions preforming actions:

Humans:

A mighty force to be reckoned with. Armed with an exceptional arsenal, they surely are a worthy enemy. This starter deck holds 60 cards of pure terror to stand against gnomes and their invasion. Use them wisely!

Gnomes:

The elite of the most elite. This fearsome army, with many futuristic superweapons, is ready. Gnome forces have prepared decades for this invasion. This starter deck holds 60 cards of regal power. Use them wisely!

Description:

Invasion Cards are here!
Take control and play as gnomes or humans. Defeat your opponent in a duel and get awarded with a privilege to live on this planet.
Two factions in a total of 120 cards will captivate players across the world. Be the one that prevails!

“Invasion has begun! Try your hand in fending off the invading forces or be the one who will destroy the humanity”

Name: Die Eroberer (fan Expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
... and the time came when the rival princes of Carcassonne became more and more power-hungry and strove with all means for the crown of the dominion.
So they invented new ways of protecting their cities and weakening those of their opponents; they built longer roads and conquered farms than all the princes before them.
They did not even shy away from occult powers - despite their Christian cathedrals.
A new, dark age had dawned...

This expansion introduces the following features to Carcassonne:
  - field path 
  - infinite crossing
  - oracle
  - siege
  - watch tower
  - ruin

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Darkness Rising
Description:
Count Mortas feeds off the life force of the citizens of Ebonwood, a pocket dimension shrouded in perpetual twilight. New heroes rise to take down the Count and they too can draw power from the darkness. But they must be careful, if they draw too much power that way all will be lost.

Darkness Rising introduces new Corruptions to Thunderstone Quest. These cards will be obtained by players, sometimes by choice, sometimes not.  They grant great power, but at steep costs.

Darkness Rising is part of The Enemies Among Us, a 2-Quest Kickstarter also featuring Miricelle's Return.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rock Band Fights Evil
Description:
Rock Band Fights Evil is the next game project from Pocket Option Games. In this game, players control a rock band attempting to escape demons from Hell, or the demons tracking down the cheapskates trying to skip out on their deal with the devil. It is a diceless 2-player game played on a hex map, involving movement and strategic placement of playing pieces.

Rock Band Fights Evil is a simple diceless game, with no luck or chance elements.

Setup - The Hell player places one demon in each hex that is not a corner (three hexes per map edge). The Rock Band player places the relic in the center of the map. He then places one member of the rock band in each hex adjacent to the relic, so that the band surrounds the relic.

Goal - The Rock Band player's goal is to move the relic off any map edge. The Hell player's goal is to get past the rock band and destroy the relic.

Turn Sequence - The Rock Band player chooses one token and moves that rocker any number of hexes in a straight line up to its Move trait. Under most circumstances, rockers cannot enter occupied hexes. After that rocker moves, he may attack. Each token has a unique method of attacking and defeating opponents, e.g. "kill each adjacent demon that has no Hell tokens next to it." When that rocker's move and attack have been resolved, play proceeds to the Hell player. The Hell player's turn sequence is identical to the Rock Band player's.

Move: Different pieces have different Move values, so the humans have to stay on their toes. Some people are a little quicker than others. We all had that one kid in school who always ended up on our team, but never could pull his own weight. For most of my childhood, I was that kid. Also, demons tend to be a lot quicker than humans. Life's like that.

Attack: After a unit moves, it can then Attack. This is a diceless act that depends entirely on the positioning of your unit.

Win Condition: The rockers are trying to retrieve a relic that they intend to use to free themselves from their contract. I won't ruin the surprise; read the books! Anyway, if the rockers can move the relic off the map, they win! If the demons ever are able to maneuver into a position to destroy the relic, they win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deep State: High Society Mini-Expansion
Description:
Deep State: High Society is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The High Society is a closed club, admitting only members of the old dynasties that have not yet lost their influence and capital.

These families have centuries of experience in the behind-the-scenes of warfare and hold many secrets and privileges. By winning and retaining their support, you will put the full power of traditional institutions at your service.

During your turn, you may use your Action to capture a High Society card. It costs you 3 Agents.

At the end of the game, the player with the most High Society cards scores 20 Influence points. The second place for the number of High Society cards brings them 10 points. Next, 5 points for being third and no points for being late.

High Society is fully compatible with Deep State: New World Order and the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.

Name: Deep State: Ultimate Deep State Mini-Expansion
Description:
Ultimate Deep State is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The highest stage of a Project development brings world dominance. It may take radical forms that knock out any competition. No matter how powerful the ‘Committee’ is, it is vulnerable to its own subdivision heads.

Victory in a World Domination Project, including the total neutralization of the ‘Committee’ and all its structures, costs more and brings higher risks. Its reward is a clean slate... while sitting atop the world as its one and only ruler.

The Ultimate Deep State promo mini-expansion allows for instant victory when you reach Stage V in any Project, instead of winning with Influence. Each Stage V has higher requirements only experienced players can meet.

There is also a "soft" version — with less difficult requirements, Stage V grants more influence and no instant victory.

This expansion contains overlays for Stages V for the 4 base set Projects and the 6 Projects from the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is fully compatible with all modules and mini-expansions from the Deep State: Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.

Name: Lose Your In-Laws
Description:
Lose Your In-Laws is a fun card game specially made to test your 'in-law dodging skills'.

The goal is to keep all your in-laws out of your house! If there are three or more in-law cards inside your house, you'll lose the game. But, it gets even worse! If the mother-in-law has entered your house, you'll lose immediately! 
So make sure your front door is always closed!

Use 'trouble cards' to open the doors of other players and keep your own door closed with 'action cards'. Get rid of in-laws in front of your door with good 'excuse cards' or send someone away with a 'get out card'.

Are you the last player standing? Can you resist your visiting in-laws? Then you'll win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Watergate: Change in History
Description:
Watergate: Change in History is a pair of promo cards for Watergate that was originally given to attendees of the 2020 Camp Capstone virtual convention. Later available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

One card is for the Nixon player and the other is for the Editor player. If one game of Watergate follows another without the players switching roles, whichever player lost receives their promo card, with that card providing an advantageous action that may be used once at any point in the game.

The two cards are:
The Day After: Move 1 evidence token 2 steps.
Meet the Press: Move the momentum token 2 steps.

Name: Zeke's Gold Grab!
Description:
Have you always wanted to stake your claim, strike gold, and spark the next gold rush?  Those days may be long gone, but you can capture that same spirit with Zeke’s Gold Grab,  Where players take tricks to try and grab the most gold!  Join Zeke and his trusty Burro for an adventure in gold country you and your family won’t soon forget.
â€‹
Zeke's Gold Grab is a classic "trick-taking" card game, themed to the Gold Rush of yore, with special cards and unique game play to keep prospectors on their toes.

The object of the game is to win the most gold. Beware of Fool’s Gold, shake things up with an Earthquake, strike it rich with a Gold Rush, or go wild with Burro. But whatever you do, just remember, NOTHING beats the Mother Lode!

—description from the publisher

Name: リアルタイムデコイ (Realtime Decoy)
Description:
A fully cooperative game for 2-4 players. Non-turn-based, real-time progression! Don't try and rush things, work together aim to win together! With 89 cards and over 60 quests this RPG-style board game can be played over and over again for a long time!

How to win
Players must work together to complete all events.
When a player loses all the lives in their hand, everyone loses and suffers consequences.
If you're in too much of a hurry and have four TEKI cards in your hand,  everyone loses and suffers consequences.

How to Play:
The game begins with everyone being dealt four different cards: enemy, life, recovery, and camp. Then deal out the deck to all players.  Cards can be played by any player at any time (real-time) to try complete/defeat the events and advance the track token. There is no turn order.  Players can also gain skill card to help them in the events.

How the cards work
An enemy card will reduce a decoy's life. 
When a camp card is played, players can discuss and choose who is the decoy.
Play two enemy cards and the event progresses. 
Save the decoys with a recovery card.

Name: MetalSkies
Description:
Do you love epic space battles and cool miniatures?  Strategy with a small element of chance thrown in to keep you on your toes? Strive for galactic dominance amongst the stars, in  MetalSkies.

Designed for 2-4 players. Set-up time takes less than 10 minutes with a player reaching victory in 1-2 hours. Each player commands their own impressive armada that includes: Battleships, destroyers, bombers, and fighters.

You’ll begin by positioning your fleet strategically across an expansive star map before waging war for limited resources across each star lane. Set-up time takes less than 10 minutes with a player reaching victory in 1-2 hours.

To help you manage your forces, you’ll receive your own fleet card where you can track your ships, their armor, and their payloads. Start things off by framing your strategy around the player action cards you’ve been dealt and the natural advantages the star lanes provide. From there, choose from a variety of game-play tactics that fit your own command style. Sit back and search for valuable scrap, dig in behind flack barriers, or charge forward with your capital ship as you send nukes hurdling towards your enemies. Become a master of these elements, adapt, and survive, for only one can reach ultimate glory!

MetalSkies comes with four complete fleets of WWII-meets-Battlestar Galactica-themed miniatures, action and event cards, fleet management cards, gameplay tokens, multiple star charts, and finally, instructions that you can read in less than 20 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Temple of Caelum
Description:
Temple of Caelum is a 2-4 player competitive RPG strategy game. Join the quest for ascension and play as both a Hero and Demon Princess to explore the forgotten temple, summon your demonic minions, cast harrowing spells, and battle the primordial Demon King in a final showdown.


     Choose from 7 different Heroes to play
     Choose from 4 unique Demon Princesses - each with their own deck of 32 spell cards
     Summon your demon minions to attack and block your opponents from progressing
     Battle the evil Demon King and claim victory!


—description from the publisher

Name: Divided Cities (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description: With this new designed city tiles you can divide cities to keep the majority or make it at least more difficult to take over your city. On the other hand you can use them to invade. ;-)

Name: The Coast (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
Your influence can be extended to the coasts with new coast tiles, river mouths to the seas.
This expansion is base for several beautiful coast expansions.

Name: Color Wheel
Description:
Each player has a "color wheel" card.

6 cards are removed from the deck to create the "degrees pile"

Players, via the Color Wheel card, must choose as quickly as possible the color card they think is closest to the degree.
When all players have drawn their cards, they turn the card over and see who is closest.
 The closest player wins the point.
In case of a tie, no one gets a point.

A new round begins.

The player who won the point in the previous round takes the card from the top of the "degrees pile" (it symbolizes his or her point), otherwise it is discarded.

The game ends when the "degrees pile" is empty.

Name: Historia w działaniu
Description:
Historia w dziaÅ‚aniu ("History in action") is a boardgame for 2-5 players. As members of small associations and foundations you will plan and realize historical projects for local societies. 
You will get involved in whole process from planning, getting founds, realizing project and summarizing benefits for societies gained thanks to the project.

The player who will manage to complete most ambitious and accurate projects, wins.

Historia w dziaÅ‚aniu is not only a boardgame, but can also inspire by ideas, projects and sources of information shown on cards.

Historia w dziaÅ‚aniu was published for NiepodlegÅ‚a fund by Games Development in 2019 and was distributed for historical associations for free.

—description from the designer

Name: Misja Kampinos 2: Społeczeństwo
Description:
Misja Kampinos 2: SpoÅ‚eczeÅ„stwo (Mission: Kampinos 2 - Society) is a sequel for the boardgame Misja Kampinos.

It is an easy boardgame published for LGD Kampinos (Between Vistula and Kampinos association). It was distributed for free on autumn 2020.

Players as local citizens influence local government (voivode, mayor, regional council)and develop small projects and investments in their communities, counties and voivodships.

The game consists of action drafting and semicooperative mechanics. It's simple and fast, so you can play it either with your family or friends.

Every card shows a different proposition of an investment, that can be realized in communities of players in real-life. Misja Kampinos 2: SpoÅ‚eczeÅ„stwo should be treated not only as a boardgame but also as a source of inspiration for projects, that can change life of clocal citizens.

—description from the designer

Name: Dungeon Drop: Trials & Tools Mini-Expansion
Description:
Treasure Trials and Lockpick Toolkits provide new challenges with great rewards! Comes with 4 Treasure Chest dice and 2 cards with special flick zones and rules.

This mini-expansion came out of Phase Shift Games' design contest in 2020. Many thanks to the contest winner, Silverlightning, for these excellent ideas!

—description from the publisher

Name: Les clés de Fort Boyard
Description:
Les clés de Fort Boyard: 4 keys for a safe, for the gold perhaps.
Trials, puzzles, but watch out for tigers!
Go for it, guess, be skilful with your hands, observe and bluff !
Logic, skills, astuteness!
A thrilling chase between the players.
Wealth is at the end of the feat!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Les clés de Fort Boyard: 4 clés pour un coffre, pour la fortunes peut-être.
Des épreuves, des enigmes mais attention aux tigres !
On fonce, on doit deviner, être adroit de ses mains, observateur et bluffeur !
La logique, l'adresse, l'astuce!
Une course poursuite haletante entre les joueurs.
La richesse est au bout de l'exploit !

—description from the back of the box

Name: Dyad
Description:
A traditional deck trick-taking game that is rare for its use of playing paired cards rather than a single card at a time.
The game uses values 2-7 in a 2 or 3 player game, 2-9 in a 4 player game.

Lead Pairs consist of
A matched pair: Two cards sharing a suit - totaled and requiring others to follow suit.
An unmatched pair: Two cards that have different suits - totaled but not requiring others to follow suit.

Following Pairs consist of

A matched pair: Same as above.

An unmatched pair following an unmatched pair: cards are totaled.

An unmatched pair following a matched pair: the lowest card is considered the total.

A double - An unmatched pair containing a 2, following a matched pair. The higher valued card is doubled.

The highest total takes the trick; the player who takes the trick retrieves an opponent's card played to the trick and leads the next trick.

After a number of tricks (4 in a 3 or 4 player game; 6 in a 2 player game) players total the cards remaining in their hands. This is their score for the round.

At the end of the round in which any player has scored at least 50 points, the highest score wins. If tied, the tied player with the highest score in the last round wins the game.


Dyad plays with a number of variants:

Cipher - (Usually with 3 or 4 players) A player may choose to cipher prior to the start of a phase. If that player takes 0 points, the player scores 20 points.

2's - If a player ends the round with a 2 and any other card, the 2 is subtracted from the score, but having a sole 2 at the end of the round scores 20 points.

Teams - (4 players) Players on a team sit across from one another. Teamed players pass 2 cards to each other prior to the start of the phase. Teams play to score 100 points.

The game generally includes themed decks where themes include new variants.

—description from the designer

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Folklore Shadow Pack
Description:
A pack of exclusive items from Folklore: The Affliction The Fall of the Spire Expansion Kickstarter campaign. Note that this pack also requires the Dark Tales Expansion to use these cards. Items include:

x4 Artifacts Card (mini size: 48x68mm)
- Cauldron of Summoning
- Crown of Thorns
- Lich's Scepter
- Ring of Shifting

x4 Rumors Card (Poker size: 3.5x2.5in)
- Dark Tower
- Lair of the Mother
- Stains on Stones
- Witch's March

x1 World Map (Metal) Group Marker (16mm base)

Name: Twisted Fables: Flood and Flame
Description:
Plunge deeper into the world of Twisted Fables! Flood and Flame includes the new fables Little Mermaid and Match Girl, both of which are ready to ensnare their adversaries - whether in tentacles or wishes; water or fire.

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Little Mermaid

Name: Twisted Fables: Dark Machinations
Description:
Dark powers stir. Relentless machines rise. Are you ready? Dark Machinations includes the new fables Dorothy and Scheherazade, neither of which would hesitate to obliterate any opponent standing in their way.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ο Κρυμμένος Θησαυρός Των Πειρατών
Description:
Ο ΚρυμμÎ­νος ΘησαυρÏŒς των ΠειρατÏŽν is an extremely rare and beautiful Disney-themed Greek board game from the late 50's or early 60's. The name translates to "Hidden treasure of the pirates". The game can be played from 2-4 players and it was released from ΕΡ.ΚΑ.Π. toy company.
 The board has a pyramid shape and each player, put his pin (pawn)at the starting point hole in his side. Every player in his turn roll the dice (roulette) and moves. The winner is the player who arrives first at the top of the mountain with the exact number of steps.

—user summary

Name: How Does Your Garden Grow
Description: A simple game that teaches basic addition and subtraction using flowers (addition) and caterpillars (subtracion)

Name: The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion
Description: The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion adds two new characters, Alistair Fairweather and Ze Amado, expanding the game up to 6 players. Alistair is another gunslinger that rivals Red and detests the supernatural. Ze Amado is an agile thief who relies on his cursed form to boost his meager attacks. This box also features upgraded components, the Fallen Immortals expansion, more bounties, encounters and additional promotional cards to mix up your play experience with the core game.

Name: Hedgemony: A Game of Strategic Choices
Description:
U.S. defense strategists and policymakers have the perennial challenge of developing capstone documents that can coherently articulate and guide how the U.S. Department of Defense will deliver and maintain combat-credible military forces to deter war and provide national security in alignment with national strategy. These forces must be ready to fight and prevail should deterrence fail against a variety of threats in an evolving and uncertain global security environment, and they must be able to do this with acceptable risks — both in the present against today's threats and in the future against threats that might emerge. Key audiences for these capstone documents include defense planners, programmers, budgeters, managers, analysts, and policymakers who support the development and management of forces that can be postured and employed in alignment with a given defense strategy to accomplish objectives.

Against this backdrop, RAND researchers developed Hedgemony, a wargame designed to teach U.S. defense professionals how different strategies could affect key planning factors in the trade space at the intersection of force development, force management, force posture, and force employment. The game presents players, representing the United States and its key strategic partners and competitors, with a global situation, competing national incentives, constraints, and objectives; a set of military forces with defined capacities and capabilities; and a pool of periodically renewable resources. The players are asked to outline their strategies and are then challenged to make difficult choices by managing the allocation of resources and forces in alignment with their strategies to accomplish their objectives within resource and time constraints.

Hedgemony can be played in a modestly sized conference room equipped with a projection screen and a table big enough for the game board and ten to 12 people. Assuming trained players and facilitators are available, a game session of the length necessary to complete a useful number of turns for the session’s learning objectives will typically require a half-day or full-day commitment. Detailed lists of required game components and full descriptions of the facilities and setup procedures necessary.

This is game is considered a governmental roleplaying game to simulate real world dynamics.

Name: Party & Co: Extreme 2.0
Description:
From the same family of Party & Co, Party & Co Extreme is made out of 4 different categories of games: 'Quiz & Co, 'Psyco & Co', 'Show & Co' and 'Art & Co'. Each category have different card games including some like Pictionary, Taboo, Trivial-Pursuit...

People have to compete with each other in teams until they fill out his objective card (a number of games won).

The game includes:
800 cards with different games (200 of each category).
48 'peanuts' (12 of each color)
A pair of party glasses (blind-drawing game) with a color pencil
2 pencils and 2 block notes
1 'flexispaghetti' (shape game)
10 objective cards
1 die and a instructions booklet

Name: Circles in the Forest (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
This expansion brings different features to the forest tiles.
You can can can use them separately or with the origin expansions. The rules of the origin expansion applies so no additional rules are required:

     3 tiles with (tree shaped) crop circles,
     3 vineyard tiles,
     3 hill tiles,
     3 bazaar tiles,
     3 tiles with flying machine symbol,
     3 tiles with mage symbol,
     2 tiles with a robber symbol,
     4 tiles with wind roses.

Name: it's KARMA! the board game
Description:
A chance/strategy roll and move derivative of the ancient reincarnation/morality game of snakes and ladders.

2-6 players compete to reach the finish by negotiating multiple path options, re-direction by special steps and employing non-player pieces to block/unblock paths for self and others.

a play option is included to extend play beyond the finish - as in the original game - such that the player that overshoots the finish returns to the game lower down the board.

3 dice are used.

—description from the publisher

Name: El lepe: Juegos autopista
Description: A racing game where you advance the more words you say from different categories in a given time. Whoever gets to the finish line first wins.

Name: SINS: The Deck-builder
Description:
GAME SYSTEM

    
    
         This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

    



 SINS is a fantasy card deck-builder with a quick setup and gameplay, filled with a plethora of combos and tough choices throughout the game, in a small package.

To win, gain power, give despair and resolve your dominance.

Components
70 x SINS cards.
20 x Kosmos (starter) cards.
2 x Dominance cards.
5 x rules cards.
3 x misc. cards.

Setup
Each box supports 2 players. Use multiple boxes when playing with more than 2 players.

Deal 10 Kosmos (starter) cards to each player. This is their draw pile, placed in their play area.

Give each player a Dominance card and place it with the Cortadoo logo facing up.

Shuffle all Sins cards together face-down, from the box sets of your choice. Place the cards in the center of the table to form the Realm.

Each player draws a card from the top of the Realm. The highest card-number is the active player (repeat if there is a tie). Destroy these cards. Destroyed cards are placed back in the box.

Then, draw 5 cards from the top of the Realm, into the center of the table, face-up.

All players draw 5 starting cards into their hand from their draw pile (this is their hand limit).

The active player starts the game and takes their first turn.
How to win
When a player reaches two dominance, that player wins the game and the game ends immediately.

You get dominance by resolving opposing despair in the Status phase, and you give despair by attacking your opponents in the Attack phase.

The Dominance card in front of each player has numbers from zero to three. If you’d like to play a longer game, you can optionally play until a player reaches three dominance. For a short (coffee break) game, play for one dominance.

Name: Until Next Winter
Description:
Until next winter is a deck-building card game for 2-4 players with  both coop and player vs player modes of play. Each game is different,  every day offers new suffering. Easy to learn hard to master it is a  game that keeps you coming back for more as you try to survive in the  woods. Shunned by your village, with only your fellow exiles for company  you will have to work together in true cooperation. Depend on each  other for help and trust each others skills.

Your crimes are unspoken. The verdict; guilty. Your punishment,  exile. You do not know how far from the village you are taken. Deep in  the woods in the still hours of an early summer night the hoods are  taken off. Dazed and disoriented you are left to your fate. To live or  die. With nothing but your fellow condemned to keep you company. As the  morning light slowly reveals your new home in shades of grey the deep  woods comes alive around you.

You and your fellow exiles must survive as long as you can in the wilderness.  Each season you will face increasingly difficult challenges  If any  player succumbs to perils of the woods all is lost. You live together or  you die together.

—description from the publisher

Name: スーパーマリオ バランスゲーム キノコがいっぱい (Super Mario Balance Game: A Lot of Mushrooms)
Description: In this dexterity game, you balance little plastic mushrooms on top of a pipe from super mario bros.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Shield of the Viking
Description:
Game is Free & Available to PnP.  Click on Files to download.


            WINNER OF “BEST AREA CONTROL GAME” IN THE 2020 BGG SOLITAIRE GAME DESIGN CONTEST***
        
    


Shield of the Viking is a solitaire Tower Defense / Tile placement game that sets you as the Jarl of a small Viking village who is trying to survive the nightly raids from "the riders" who live in the mountains to the north.

The game is played on a board made up of hexagonal spaces that narrow down in quantity from top to bottom.  Your objective is to defend your fortress at the bottom of the board just long enough for you to put an end to the raids.

Using 4 colored die each round, the riders path down the mountain and through your village is randomized each turn.  The rider will follow the colored pattern of the die rolled through colored arrows on each of the board spaces.  The result is a snake like path causing destruction as he moves.

In between Raids, you will have the opportunity to place Viking soldiers and build defensive buildings to stop the Rider before he reaches the bottom.  However, you must also decide how many Vikings to keep in the village to defend it vs how many you want to send searching for the rider's home base to defeat them once and for all.

The PnP version was originally designed for the 2020 Solitaire PnP Contest by Joe Fontana

-description from designer

Name: Super Dungeon Explore: Devil Island
Description:
Super Dungeon: Explore - Devil Island is a standalone starter set for Super Dungeon: Explore 2nd Edition. It includes a 2nd Edition Rulebook, Hero and Monster Miniatures, Tokens, Loot and Treasure Decks, Super Dungeon Dice, and Dungeon Tiles.

Super Dungeon: Explore is a sword swinging, fireball blasting, monster-mash dungeon crawl! In Super Dungeon: Explore, one player is the Dark Consul who controls all of the dungeon’s monsters; while the remaining players are Heroes bent on stopping the Dark Consul’s evil-doings.

The Devil Island Legends Campaign provides you with a series of linked, narrative adventures featuring the Heroes Momotaro, Saru, Adzuki, and Kiji as they seek to defeat Bomechan and her foul Clan Ijin pirates! The Legends campaign includes quests for your Heroes to accomplish, loot and treasure they can keep from game to game, and dastardly power up cards for the Consul.

This exclusive starter includes a Limited Edition Saru Masterclass Miniature that is only available in this set!

Name: The Stygian Society: Stretch Goals
Description:
This pack includes stretch goals from The Stygian Society Kickstarter.

It includes:


     Rita and Delores mid-boss mat
     Eigenstein wizard mat
     The Seer character mat and 15 character cards
     4 Chest cards (Feel Great, Priming the Pump,Feel Good, Back in Action)
     3 Upper Treasure Cards (Evil Arrow, Evil Gauntlet, Evil Spellbook)
     3 Lower Treasure Cards (Clean Bill of Health, Crypt Keeper, Trap Bypass)
     5 Woe Cards (Backstab, Counterattack, Doomed, Starless Night, Stricken Down)
     5 Lamentation Cards (Exhaustion, Open Wound, Tired, Unlucky, Xanthous & Sangre)


Woe and Lamentation cards may be added to the game for an even greater challenge. Each hero starts with one Woe or Lamentation that disadvantages them or the party, much like status cards, but much harder to get rid of.

Name: Arctic Race
Description:
Arctic Race is a family game of tactical racing in polar surroundings. In the game all players sponsor two dog sled teams, and the player whose both teams have reached the North Pole first, wins.

Each player is dealt a card showing the two teams that the player sponsors. The players keep their cards hidden, so the players' teams are unknown. Several players can share a single team, but only one player can have a specific combination of two teams. The board is built differently for every game out of big ice floats. Several weather hazards surround the ice track at the beginning of the game, and are moved onto the track during the game. The players are granted godlike abilities in the game, as they are allowed to move the hazards on their turn, as well as any dog sled they wish. If a hazard is ever moved into the same space as a dog sled, the dog sled cannot move before the hazard has been moved away.

The game is played by rolling two dice: a movement die and a hazard die. The movement die lets the player move a dog sled 1-4 spaces on the board, and sometimes ALSO lets the player place a crack in the ice on the board. Cracks can only be crossed by using ladder cards that the players have three of when the game starts. Without ladders cracks cannot be crossed and players have to go around them. The hazard die usually lets the player move one of three types of hazards, sometimes it allows a free choice of hazards, and sometimes the player can move no hazard at all. All this makes for a very exciting race, and an entertaining 30+ minutes.

Name: VI-hunter
Description: The more viruses you capture, you can be the best VIRUS HUNTER! Collect the most virus cards including super-virus by matching cards on both ends any row. You can use vaccines to remove virus.

Name: Lost & Found (fan expansion for The 7th Continent)
Description:
Lost & Found is an unofficial fan-made print-and-play mini-expansion for The 7th Continent.

Many things and even more people got lost on the 7th continent.
Some want to be found, some do not, and some should not.

It's primarily meant for the players who "have seen it all", as it brings new uses for the old places and familiar items. Good knowledge of the continent will come in handy, however, there are enough hints that you shouldn't get completely lost even without previous experience.
If you want to learn more about the theme read the Clue card on the first page of the PNP to discover more.

The expansion contains 2 modules:

     You can play with the new curse "The Lost Artefact", alone or alongside any other curses. It is a medium length curse (~10 hours), with multiple parallel objectives.
     You can add the "Book of Idols" card to your game, even when not playing with the new curse, in the same way, you would add the "Pocket Watch" from the "Path Of Repentance" expansion.


General features:

     Compatible with all editions of the base game and all the official expansions.
     No cards from this expansion are ever shuffled with the original cards (so you don't have to worry about matching backs etc.). There is no new Curse card included, for this very reason.
     The Blue Adventure cards form their own deck with green and golden numbered cards the only difference is that their "numbox" is blue.


Contents:

     1 Rules card
     1 Clue card for the new curse of "The Lost Artefact"
     1 "Book of Idols" card
     90 Blue Adventure Cards, forming the separate Blue Adventure Deck
     You can also print your own 000 and 100 blue dividers

Name: 13 Monsters: Armed to the Teeth
Description:
13 Monsters: Armed to the Teeth is an expansion pack for 13 Monsters that adds weapons, armor, loot piles, new metal-type monsters, extra battle/loot mechanics and the oddest smithy anyone has ever met; Trall.

The added game elements fit neatly in the already-established player rounds from the base game and opens up many new opportunities during each players turn. Throw the new action granting dice to score loot from the armory. Equip your monsters with weapons and Armour, each with their own special abilities that affect the card-collection phase, battles or even your opponents monsters.

—description from the designer

Name: Constellations: The "Add to 34" Space Age Noughts and Crosses Game
Description:
Constellations is based on the magic number square devised in the 15th century by Albrecht Durera in which each row and column and long diagonal sum to 34. Other patterns of four squares also sum to 34. These are called "Constellations".

Each round, players take turns placing markers on the board until one of them has markers covering the four points of a constellation.

The card with that constellation on it is awarded to the winner of the round. If it is the top card of the deck, then the game is over. Otherwise, players play another round. Most cards and points at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

Name: Yakatabune
Description:
In Yakatabune, a.k.a. å±‹å½¢èˆ¹, an area-majority puzzle game, you and another player are rival pyrotechnicians who are competing to prove your mastery in the summer's most anticipated fireworks festival. To do so, you need to place fireworks cards on your side of the river to complete your program cards while attempting to earn the applause of each "yakatabune" — that is, "houseboat" — card by having a majority in that column.

In more detail, to set up lay out the seven yakatabune cards in a row; place three starter fireworks (value 1) on the starting player's side of the board and four starters on the other side in alternating columns. You start with two cards in hand from your deck of 13 cards, and you choose two program cards from the three you're dealt.

On a turn, play a fireworks card on your side of the board in the closest empty space next to a yakatabune on your choice. Your opponent may then use the effect of that fireworks card — swapping two cards, shifting a card to an adjacent space, or flipping a card — on either their cards, your cards, or the yakatabune, depending on the icons depicted on the associated yakatabune. Alternatively, your opponent may decline to use the effect and instead draw a program card.

After you play a card, if you have a program card in hand that matches the pattern of fireworks on your side of the board, you can play that card, take the bonus actions on it to shift one or more of your cards, then play another program card if you now have that pattern.

Next, if the number of cards surrounding a yakatabune equals or exceeds that boat's limit, you sum the fireworks on each side to see who has captured the awe of the viewers on that boat. Mark this boat with an applause token, then turn all of the winning player's fireworks face down. (Face-down cards can still be used to complete many pattern cards.) End your turn by drawing a fireworks card from your deck.

When the game ends after five applause tokens have been placed or the fireworks or program cards run out, players tally their collected awe to see who wins.

•••

Name: Taxi! Board Game: England Rugby
Description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.
Families: Series: Taxi Board Game (Taxi Game Ltd)

Name: Fort Boyard
Description:
This game is the boardgame version of the French TV Game Show Fort Boyard.

Alone or in a team, conquer the Fort! Pass the most varied trials to collect keys and clues!
Meet the emblematic characters of the Fort: Father Fouras, the Masters of Time and many others.
Face the Council and decipher more than 100 riddles of Father Fouras.
Speed, concentration and courage will allow you to access the Treasure Room so that you can open it with the WORD CODE.
An action adventure game for the whole family!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Seul ou en équipe, partez à la conquête du Fort ! Réussissez les épreuves les plus variées pour collecter les clés et les indices !
Retrouvez les personnages emblématiques du Fort : le Père Fouras, les Maîtres du Temps et bien d’autres.
Affrontez le Conseil et décryptez plus de 100 énigmes du Père Fouras.
Rapidité, concentration et courage vous permettront d’accéder à la Salle du trésor pour pouvoir l’ouvrir grâce au MOT CODE.
Un jeu d’action et d’aventure pour toute la famille !

—description from the publisher

Name: Fort Boyard: Escape Box
Description:
Live the Fort Boyard experience at home with this escape box!

Take part in the great Fort Boyard game with your friends! Solve the puzzles, collect the clues and the keys to open the treasure room! 
Can you find the correct code word within 45 minutes? 
Let's go for the adventure! 
Always higher, always further, always stronger!

Included: a poster and a 45-minute soundtrack with the official credits of the show to immerse you in the atmosphere!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vis l'expérience Fort Boyard chez toi grâce à cette escape box !

Participe au grand jeu Fort Boyard avec tes amis ! 
Résous les énigmes, récupère les indices et les clés pour ouvrir la salle du trésor ! 
Trouverez-vous le bon mot code dans les 45 minutes imparties ? C'est parti pour l'aventure ! 
Toujours plus haut, toujours plus loin, toujours plus fort !

Inclus : un poster et une bande son de 45 minutes avec le générique officiel de l'émission pour t'immerger dans l'ambiance !

—description from the publisher

Name: Pulp Alley Fortune Card: Thanks!
Description:
This is a single promotional Fortune Card for Pulp Alley intended to be used with the normal stack of Fortune Cards 
Card Name: Thanks!
Card ID: PAX promo 2018

—user summary

Name: Bob's Your Uncle
Description:
Bob’s Your Uncle is an Australian themed version of the popular game Time’s Up! It is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring famous historical or fictional characters and chooses some of them. Each player's cards are shuffled to form a deck, and this deck of famous names is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!

Name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Carthaginois
Description:
Expand your prospects for glory with ARS BELLUM game expansions.
In this expansion, find the Carthaginian army and the troops of the First Punic War
Counters, Cards, a dice, the victory is in your hands!

The Carthaginian extension contains:

     1 scenario booklet to play the battles
         Agrigentum (261 BC),
         Adys (255 BC)
         Bagradas (255 BC)
    
     1 board of 54 pawns representing the Carthaginian army during the First Punic War
     3 A3 cards


Requires the base module of ARS BELLUM

—description from the publisher (translated)

Elargissez vos perspectives de gloire avec les Extensions du jeu ARS BELLUM
Dans cette extension, retrouvez l'armée carthaginoise et les troupes de la Première Guerre punique
Les pions, les cartes, un dé, la victoire est entre vos mains !

L' extension Carthaginois contient:

     1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles 
         d'Agrigentum (261 av JC), 
         d'Adys (255 av JC), 
         de Bagradas (255 av JC)
    
     1 planche de 54 pions représentant l'armée carthaginoise durant la Première Guerre punique
     3 cartes A3


Nécessite le module de base d' ARS BELLUM

—description from the publisher

Name: Word-O
Description:
The Word-O box contains a set of 13 alpha dice, a sand timer and a dice cup.

On a turn a player rolls all the dice. Sets the timer and then tries to make the highest scoring "mini" crossword before the time runs out. Like scrabble, each letter is worth points related to how difficult it will be to use. Some of the die have a wild symbol on them that can be used for any letter (at zero points).

—user summary

Name: Impractical Jokers: Box of Challenges
Description:
400 game cards, challenges, awkward scenarios & accessories.

Think you’ve got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now’s your chance to put yourself to the test with the Impractical Jokers game. Whether you like pulling off undercover challenges on friends or just laughing at hilariously awkward card combinations, this game has something for you. Phase 1: Mess with unsuspecting friends and family. Phase 2: Match uncomfortable scenario cards with hysterical action cards. Phase 3: The Punishment.

Name: Fort Boyard: Escape Box
Description:
Can you escape the Fort?

You have just finished the challenges, you have positioned yourself on the code word, but the Boyards do not fall.
Rouge has taken control of the Fort: you have 45 minutes to find a way to bring down the Boyards, take whatever you can and escape.
If you do not succeed, you will remain prisoners.
It's your turn !
You have 45 minutes and not one more!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Réussirez-vous à vous échapper du Fort ?

Vous venez de terminer les épreuves, vous vous êtes positionnés sur le mot-code, mais les Boyards ne tombent pas. 
Rouge a pris le contrôle du Fort : vous avez 45 minutes pour trouver le moyen de faire tomber les Boyards, prendre tout ce que vous pouvez et vous enfuir. 
Si vous n'y arrivez pas, vous resterez prisonniers. 
À vous de jouer !
Vous avez 45 minutes et pas une de plus !

—description from the publisher

Name: The Choo Choo Game: the train drafting game
Description:
Choo Choo Game is a Card Drafting game for 2 to 6 players.
Draft a card from the hand to build the longest train. Train carriages must be built in order, Locomotive, Coal carriage, People carriage and Flatbed carriage, The Box Carriage is wild and can be placed anywhere after the Locomotive. If you cannot take a correct carriage from the hand on your turn you must pay a penalty of one carriage from your train. Once a full hand of cannot be drawn the game is over and who ever has the longest train wins.
Features old style art of Locomotives and Carriages.
A Deck of 55 cards.
